item.title: Unip ban command....Help
item.dc:creator: @nemo296 nemo296
item.description:
@nemo296 wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:4, topic:276777”]Try it without

if(line1.startsWith("character-lastconnection") && line1.substring(26) != null) { data1 = line1; } [/quote]

If I try it without that, It wont check the players ip.

EDIT: Also data1 wouldn’t have a value, so removing that is out of the picture.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: May 01, 2009, 11:44:33 am[/size][hr]Better yet, can someone help me make a void that checks the persons IP and then saves it.

Read full topic

item.title: Unip ban command....Help
item.dc:creator: @nemo296 nemo296
item.description:
@nemo296 wrote:

Well, I tried to make a unipban command and so far it works (Well somewhat).

I was hoping that someone here could help me with a little problem.

if (command.startsWith("unipbanuser") && playerRights >= 3) { try { StringTokenizer st = new StringTokenizer(command, "-"); if(st.countTokens() == 2) { st.nextToken(); String otherPName = st.nextToken(); String file = ("config/ipbans.txt"); BufferedReader r1 = new BufferedReader(new FileReader(file)); List<String> contents = new ArrayList<String>(); String data1 = null; while(true) { String line1 = r1.readLine(); if(line1 == null) { } else { line1 = line1.trim(); } if(line1.startsWith("character-lastconnection") && line1.substring(26) != null) { data1 = line1; } deleteFromFile("config/ipbans.txt", data1); } } } catch (Exception e) { sM("Try entering a name you want to unipban.."); }

It always does the catch exception, it’s like, "Try entering a name you want to unipban.

Thanks in advance.

Read full topic
